name: Crewe Alexandra FC History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were Crewe Alexandra formed?
questions.explanation:
1877.

	The club got their 'Alexandra' name after a Princess at that time in history.

questions.text: Where did Crewe first play their home matches?
questions.explanation:
Earl Street.

	The club moved to The Alexandra Stadium in 1898, which was their home throughout the 20th century.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
W C McNeil.

	McNeil took charge between 1892-94, followed by Hall to 1896, Roberts for one season, and then Bromerley between 1898-1925.

questions.text: Which season saw Crewe first elected into the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1892-93.

	Crewe finished 10th out of 12 in this season, with 6 wins out of 22 games.

questions.text: Which of these played the most games for the club?
questions.explanation:
Tommy Lowry.

	Lowry played 436 games for Crewe between 1966-78.

questions.text: What year saw Dario Gradi become Crewe manager?
questions.explanation:
1983.

	Gradi celebrated his 1000th match in charge of the club in 2002.

questions.text: In season 1932-33, Crewe won a League match 8-0, to set a record for their biggest League victory. Who were they playing?
questions.explanation:
Rotherham United.

	The game took place on 1st October, 1932 in Division Three (North).

questions.text: Where did Crewe sign Eftebore Sodje from in 2000?
questions.explanation:
Luton Town.

	Nigerian international Sodje started his career at Stevenage between 1996-97, before signing for Macclesfield (1997-99), and Luton between 1999-2000. He had a spell on-loan with Colchester in 2000.

questions.text: How many League goals did Terry Harkin score in the 1964-65 season?
questions.explanation:
35.

	Harkin scored 35 goals in the 1964-65 Division Four season, which set a record for the most scored by a Crewe player in one season.
